headers.subject: [tosdr:2807] Ancestry.com account can be cancelled based on a belief

subject: Ancestry.com account can be cancelled based on a belief
text:
That's standard. No service I know of requires hard evidence that a user is in breach of the Terms of Service. If they did, service providers would basically have to take users to court in order to terminate their accounts. That'd be an unsustainably heavy burden. Generally, online services are private companies, and it's okay for them to state that they can deny service to anyone they think is being disruptive.

-- 
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr
